segment.source: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client Deployment
segment.target: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client Deployment

segment.source: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client Deployment
segment.target: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client Deployment

segment.source: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client Deployment
segment.target: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Sequencer and Client Deployment

segment.source: Before you can start to use Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0, you must install the App-V 5.0 sequencer, the App-V 5.0 client, and optionally the App-V 5.0 shared content store.
segment.target: Before you can start to use Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0, you must install the App-V 5.0 sequencer, the App-V 5.0 client, and optionally the App-V 5.0 shared content store.

segment.source: The following sections address planning for these installations.
segment.target: The following sections address planning for these installations.

segment.source: Planning for App-V 5.0 sequencer deployment
segment.target: Planning for App-V 5.0 sequencer deployment

segment.source: App-V 5.0 uses a process called sequencing to create virtualized applications and application packages.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 uses a process called sequencing to create virtualized applications and application packages.

segment.source: Sequencing requires the use of a computer that runs the App-V 5.0 sequencer.
segment.target: Sequencing requires the use of a computer that runs the App-V 5.0 sequencer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For information about the new functionality of App-V 5.0 sequencer, see the Changes to the sequencer section of What's New in App-V 5.0.
segment.target: For information about the new functionality of App-V 5.0 sequencer, see the Changes to the sequencer section of What's New in App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The computer that runs the App-V 5.0 sequencer must meet the minimum system requirements.
segment.target: The computer that runs the App-V 5.0 sequencer must meet the minimum system requirements.

segment.source: For a list of these requirements, see App-V 5.0 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For a list of these requirements, see App-V 5.0 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: Ideally, you should install the sequencer on a computer running as a virtual machine.
segment.target: Ideally, you should install the sequencer on a computer running as a virtual machine.

segment.source: This enables you to more easily revert the computer running the sequencer to a “clean” state before sequencing another application.
segment.target: This enables you to more easily revert the computer running the sequencer to a “clean” state before sequencing another application.

segment.source: When you install the sequencer using a virtual machine, you should perform the following steps:
segment.target: When you install the sequencer using a virtual machine, you should perform the following steps:

segment.source: Install all associated sequencer prerequisites.
segment.target: Install all associated sequencer prerequisites.

segment.source: Install the sequencer.
segment.target: Install the sequencer.

segment.source: Take a “snapshot” of the environment.
segment.target: Take a “snapshot” of the environment.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You should have your corporate security team review and approve the sequencing process plan.
segment.target: You should have your corporate security team review and approve the sequencing process plan.

segment.source: For security reasons, you should keep the sequencer operations in a lab that is separate from the production environment.
segment.target: For security reasons, you should keep the sequencer operations in a lab that is separate from the production environment.

segment.source: The separation arrangement can be as simple or as comprehensive as necessary, based on your business requirements.
segment.target: The separation arrangement can be as simple or as comprehensive as necessary, based on your business requirements.

segment.source: The sequencing computers must be able to connect to the corporate network to copy finished packages to the production servers.
segment.target: The sequencing computers must be able to connect to the corporate network to copy finished packages to the production servers.

segment.source: However, because the sequencing computers are typically operated without antivirus protection, they must not be on the corporate network unprotected.
segment.target: However, because the sequencing computers are typically operated without antivirus protection, they must not be on the corporate network unprotected.

segment.source: For example, you might be able to operate behind a firewall or on an isolated network segment.
segment.target: For example, you might be able to operate behind a firewall or on an isolated network segment.

segment.source: You might also be able to use virtual machines that are configured to share an isolated virtual network.
segment.target: You might also be able to use virtual machines that are configured to share an isolated virtual network.

segment.source: Follow your corporate security policies to safely address these concerns.
segment.target: Follow your corporate security policies to safely address these concerns.

segment.source: How to Install the Sequencer
segment.target: How to Install the Sequencer

segment.source: Planning for App-V 5.0 client deployment
segment.target: Planning for App-V 5.0 client deployment

segment.source: To run virtualized packages on target computers, you must install the App-V 5.0 client on the target computers.
segment.target: To run virtualized packages on target computers, you must install the App-V 5.0 client on the target computers.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client is the component that runs a virtualized application on a target computer.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client is the component that runs a virtualized application on a target computer.

segment.source: The client enables users to interact with icons and specific file types to start virtualized applications.
segment.target: The client enables users to interact with icons and specific file types to start virtualized applications.

segment.source: The client also helps obtain application content from the management server and caches the content before the client starts the application.
segment.target: The client also helps obtain application content from the management server and caches the content before the client starts the application.

segment.source: There are two different client types: the client for Remote Desktop Services, which is used on Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server systems and the App-V 5.0 client, which is used for all other computers.
segment.target: There are two different client types: the client for Remote Desktop Services, which is used on Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server systems and the App-V 5.0 client, which is used for all other computers.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client should be configured by using either the installer command line or by using a PowerShell script after the installation has been completed.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client should be configured by using either the installer command line or by using a PowerShell script after the installation has been completed.

segment.source: The settings must be defined carefully in advance in order to expedite the deployment of the App-V 5.0 client software.
segment.target: The settings must be defined carefully in advance in order to expedite the deployment of the App-V 5.0 client software.

segment.source: This is especially important when you have computers in different offices where the clients must be configured to use different source locations.
segment.target: This is especially important when you have computers in different offices where the clients must be configured to use different source locations.

segment.source: You must also determine how you will deploy the client software.
segment.target: You must also determine how you will deploy the client software.

segment.source: Although it is possible to deploy the client manually on each computer, most organizations prefer to deploy the client through an automated process.
segment.target: Although it is possible to deploy the client manually on each computer, most organizations prefer to deploy the client through an automated process.

segment.source: A larger organization might have an operational Electronic Software Distribution (ESD) system, which is an ideal client deployment system.
segment.target: A larger organization might have an operational Electronic Software Distribution (ESD) system, which is an ideal client deployment system.

segment.source: If no ESD system exists, you can use your organization’s standard method of installing software.
segment.target: If no ESD system exists, you can use your organization’s standard method of installing software.

segment.source: Possible methods include Group Policy or various scripting techniques.
segment.target: Possible methods include Group Policy or various scripting techniques.

segment.source: Depending on the quantity and disparate locations of your client computers, this deployment process can be complex.
segment.target: Depending on the quantity and disparate locations of your client computers, this deployment process can be complex.

segment.source: You must use a structured approach to ensure that all computers get the client installed with the correct configuration.
segment.target: You must use a structured approach to ensure that all computers get the client installed with the correct configuration.

segment.source: For a list of the client minimum requirements see App-V 5.0 Prerequisites.
segment.target: For a list of the client minimum requirements see App-V 5.0 Prerequisites.

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V Client

segment.source: Planning for App-V client coexistence
segment.target: Planning for App-V client coexistence

segment.source: You can deploy the App-V 5.0 client side by side with the App-V 4.6 client.
segment.target: You can deploy the App-V 5.0 client side by side with the App-V 4.6 client.

segment.source: Client coexistence requires that you add or publish virtualized applications by using either a deployment configuration file or a user configuration file, because there are certain settings in these configuration files that must be configured in order for App-V 5.0 to function with App-V 4.6 clients.
segment.target: Client coexistence requires that you add or publish virtualized applications by using either a deployment configuration file or a user configuration file, because there are certain settings in these configuration files that must be configured in order for App-V 5.0 to function with App-V 4.6 clients.

segment.source: When a package is upgraded by using either the client or the server, the package must resubmit the configuration file.
segment.target: When a package is upgraded by using either the client or the server, the package must resubmit the configuration file.

segment.source: This is true for any package that has a corresponding configuration file, so it is not specific to client coexistence.
segment.target: This is true for any package that has a corresponding configuration file, so it is not specific to client coexistence.

segment.source: However, if you do not submit the configuration file during the package upgrade, then the package state will not function as expected in coexistence scenarios.
segment.target: However, if you do not submit the configuration file during the package upgrade, then the package state will not function as expected in coexistence scenarios.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 dynamic configuration files customize a package for a specific user.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 dynamic configuration files customize a package for a specific user.

segment.source: You must create the dynamic user configuration (.xml) file or the dynamic deployment configuration file before you can use them.
segment.target: You must create the dynamic user configuration (.xml) file or the dynamic deployment configuration file before you can use them.

segment.source: To create the file it requires an advanced manual operation.
segment.target: To create the file it requires an advanced manual operation.

segment.source: When a dynamic user configuration file is used, none of the App-V 5.0 information for the extension in the manifest file is used.
segment.target: When a dynamic user configuration file is used, none of the App-V 5.0 information for the extension in the manifest file is used.

segment.source: This means that the dynamic user configuration file must include everything for the extension that is specific to App-V 5.0 in the manifest file, as well as the changes that you want to make, such as, deletions and updates.
segment.target: This means that the dynamic user configuration file must include everything for the extension that is specific to App-V 5.0 in the manifest file, as well as the changes that you want to make, such as, deletions and updates.

segment.source: For more information about how to create a custom configuration file, see How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console.
segment.target: For more information about how to create a custom configuration file, see How to Create a Custom Configuration File by Using the App-V 5.0 Management Console.

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V 4.6 and the App-V 5.0 Client on the Same Computer
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V 4.6 and the App-V 5.0 Client on the Same Computer

segment.source: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Shared Content Store (SCS)
segment.target: Planning for the App-V 5.0 Shared Content Store (SCS)

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 shared content store mode allows the computer running the App-V 5.0 client to run virtualized applications and none of the package contents is saved on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 shared content store mode allows the computer running the App-V 5.0 client to run virtualized applications and none of the package contents is saved on the computer running the App-V 5.0 client.

segment.source: Virtual applications are streamed to target computers only when requested by the client.
segment.target: Virtual applications are streamed to target computers only when requested by the client.

segment.source: The following list displays some of the benefits of using the App-V 5.0 shared content store:
segment.target: The following list displays some of the benefits of using the App-V 5.0 shared content store:

segment.source: Reduced app-to-app and multi-user application conflicts and hence a reduced need for regression testing
segment.target: Reduced app-to-app and multi-user application conflicts and hence a reduced need for regression testing

segment.source: Accelerated application deployment by reduction of deployment risk
segment.target: Accelerated application deployment by reduction of deployment risk

segment.source: Simplified profile management
segment.target: Simplified profile management

segment.source: How to Install the App-V 5.0 Client for Shared Content Store Mode
segment.target: How to Install the App-V 5.0 Client for Shared Content Store Mode

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
